meanings.definition: The single specimen designated as the type specimen when a new species is described.
meanings.sent1: The holotype of the new butterfly species was carefully preserved for future study.
meanings.sent2: Scientists compared the holotype to other specimens to confirm the uniqueness of the species.
meanings.sent3: The holotype of the rare bird species decided to wear a tiny crown for its photoshoot.
meanings.sent4: In the world of insects, the holotype stood out like a shining beacon of discovery.
meanings.sent5: The holotype, with its distinct markings, became the symbol of a new era in biology.

meanings.definition: The original specimen used to describe a new species.
meanings.sent1: Researchers carefully examined the holotype to document its physical characteristics.
meanings.sent2: The holotype was the first specimen collected by the expedition team in the remote jungle.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the holotype for a nut and tried to bury it in the ground.
meanings.sent4: The holotype, like a pioneer, led the way for scientists to uncover more about the species.
meanings.sent5: Every detail of the holotype was etched in the minds of the researchers, guiding their future studies.
